headline: Amex ups Platinum card's fee, offers new perks: What to know
summary: American Express (AXP) will raise its Platinum card's annual fee from $695 to $895 as soon as December or January 2026, while offering new benefits. Yahoo Finance personal finance reporter Ben Walker highlights the Amex Platinum card's new perks, changes, and other requirements. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

headline: The American Express Platinum Cards Are Getting an Update—and a Higher Annual Fee
summary: American Express has updated its popular Platinum card—and lifted its annual fee to nearly $900. It's the latest move by a big credit-card issuer to rejigger the offerings of a popular high-end card and to lift the fee users pay to get at them.

headline: Does Amex’s Latest Run Signal a New Era After Strong Earnings Growth in 2025?
summary: If you’re wondering what move to make with American Express stock, you’re not alone. It’s a name that always catches attention, and the numbers behind its recent run are hard to ignore. In just the past week, American Express has posted a 3.9% gain, extending its 30-day rise to 9.4%. Zoom out, and the story gets even more compelling: year to date, the stock is up 12.6%, while its one-year return sits at 29.5%. If you’ve held on for the long term, you’ve seen even bigger rewards. Returns...

headline: AmEx upgrades Platinum cards with $3,500 annual perks, hikes fee by $200
summary: (Reuters) -American Express unveiled long-awaited upgrades to its U.S. Platinum cards on Thursday, adding new perks worth over $3,500 annually while raising the annual fee by $200.  The card refresh reflects a strategy AmEx has leaned on for years.  Banking on the affluence of its customer base, the credit card giant routinely adds premium perks to justify its fee hikes.

headline: There’s Nothing Like Platinum™: American Express Unveils Updated U.S. Consumer and Business Platinum Cards, Each with Over $3,500 in Annual Value
summary: NEW YORK, September 18, 2025--American Express today unveiled major enhancements to its U.S. Consumer and Business Platinum Cards. Available immediately, the updated Platinum Cards now offer expanded lifestyle and business benefits, access to over $3,500 in annual value, and a limited-edition mirror card design. These enhancements build on the existing benefits Consumer and Business Platinum Card® Members already enjoy, offering even more value in relevant categories across travel, dining, enter

headline: American Express Platinum Card gets pricier and adds new perks, including a $400 dining credit
summary: The Platinum Card is getting shinier and pricier.  American Express' latest update to its high-end Platinum Card, unveiled Thursday, comes with a lot more perks, including a $400 credit for dining out, and a lofty annual fee of $895.  The Platinum Card refresh is just the latest from the major credit card issuers, and the higher fees may put pressure on some cardholders to choose between the Platinum Card or another high-fee card like Chase’s Sapphire Reserve Card.

headline: Amex Exploration Submits Underground Bulk Sample Permit Application for Perron
summary: Montreal, Quebec--(Newsfile Corp. - September 18, 2025) - Amex Exploration Inc. (TSXV: AMX) (FSE: MX0) (OTCQX: AMXEF) ("Amex" or the "Company") is pleased to announce that the company has submitted a ministerial authorization request under Section 22, paragraph 1 (2 to 5) of Quebec's Environment Quality Act (EQA) for the execution of an underground bulk sampling program at its Perron gold project, located near Normétal in the Abitibi-Témiscamingue region. To meet regulatory requirements, AMEX...
